intro: Senecio tashiroi, commonly known as Tashiro's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces small, cylindrical fruits known as cypsela. Senecio tashiroi is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
